== 2.1 Unconditionally terminate the iteration ==

This keyword is similar to `break` in C language. It will unconditionally terminate the iteration and return the value. The syntax is: `(return EXPRESSION)`, where the EXPRESSION is any Lisp form.

||  || {{{ (++ (for i from 100 downto 50 by 5)     (when (< i 75) (return i))) }}} ||

This example will iterate starting at 100 and decreasing the value by 5. Once the value is less then 75, it will return it (i.e. it will return 70).
